page.title: 01South skye Croft lands
page.content: Killmore to Tengue This area is typical of the crofting lands of south Skye. The community is lively and growing wih many new houses built by young couples with families, a direct consequence of the change of ownership of the area in 1971. As a result a new school was opened just south of the block in 1983 and the old school at Ferrindonald houses the lively english Playgroup, meeting twice a week. Most of the Crofters have other full or part time work, in Tourism, Farming Fishing Forstry, Building or Public services. Most of the land is owned by the Clan Donal Lands Trust and is wet, heather moorland suitable only for hill grazng for sheep, but the northeast corner is part of Fearann Eillean Iarmain, the adjacent estate whose farming centre is at Knock Farm or Cnoc Uaine, where
